name: places/ChIJ70Kcel9YwokRYkUxv5xfsV4
formattedAddress: 20 Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 20 Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, USA

editorialSummary.text: Designed by Philip Johnson in 1964, this ornate theater is home to the New York City Ballet.

originalText.text:
Definitely a memorable experience! Everything was perfect from the moment we walked in.  Security at the doors was very professional.  Than we were greeted by ushers who guided us to our seats.  We were sitting on the second ring and seemed like the perfect view.  This wasnt my first ballet experience but definitely the best play I seen.
Every member of the cast was just perfect.
No wonder that this is the most popular ballet in the world. Its a must see production with amazing costumes.  Children performance was on point and sugarplum fairy was amazing.  Whole thing is two parts.  Second part blew me away with amazing orchestra performance.
Theater itself is massive and beautiful.

originalText.text: We came to the NYC Ballet to watch The Nutcracker and it was absolutely magical. I’ve had the songs stuck in my head for days now. The dancers were so beautiful and graceful that they seemed to float on the stage. To watch this company live has always been on my bucket list but to come here and see The Nutcracker was a double bucket item on my list. I would recommend this to anyone even remotely interested, because it for not disappoint.

originalText.text: My family and I saw The Nutcracker and it was phenomenal! Everyone left saying it was a memorable experience and I can't deny that. The workers there were very nice. They had an champagne and whiskey bar which I thought was interesting. I would definitely come back and see another ballet.

text.text: My family and I saw The Nutcracker and it was phenomenal! Everyone left saying it was a memorable experience and I can't deny that. The workers there were very nice. They had an champagne and whiskey bar which I thought was interesting. I would definitely come back and see another ballet.

originalText.text: We went to see The Nutcracker and it was such a memorable experience for every person I went with. The customer service is top tier and the seating is amazing!

text.text: We went to see The Nutcracker and it was such a memorable experience for every person I went with. The customer service is top tier and the seating is amazing!

originalText.text:
It was a snowy weekend when we went to see Ballet performance at David H Theatre. We had almost canceled due to the snow piles around. Glad we did not.

The theatre amazes you right from the central location to grand entrance. Quick check of the tickets and we were in.

We had tickets towards the front so had a great view. But the theatre is such, the views would be great everywhere. The room was packed, still felt it was not jam-packed. It is the brilliance of seating and architecture of the theatre.

Room is acoustically sounds. The ballet performance itself was too good. Sit and applause kind.

Recommended!
